org.bremersee.fac

Interface FailedAccessCounter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FailedAccessCounterImpl

    public interface FailedAccessCounter

    A failed access counter stores failed access entries of a resource for a remote host, that wants to access the resource. The resource may be, for example, the login page. When the login has failed, this may be stored in the failed access counter. When the counter of the failed access entry has reached a threshold the login can be blocked for a while.
    It is a small protection against brute-force-attacks.

    Author:
    Christian Bremer

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AccessResultDto accessFailed(String resourceId, String remoteHost, Long timeInMillis)
      Stores a failed access entry for the specified resource and remote host.
      AccessResultDto accessSucceeded(String resourceId, String remoteHost, Long timeInMillis)
      Tells the access failed store that the access from the remote host to the specified resource was successfully.
      int getFailedAccessCounterThreshold()
      Returns the threshold of the counter.

        FailedAccessDto getFailedAccessEntry(String resourceId,
                                     String remoteHost)
        Gets the specified access failed entry or null, if there is no such entry.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - the resource of the access failed entry
        remoteHost - the remote host of the failed access entry
        Returns:
        the access failed entry or null

      • removeFailedAccessEntry

        BooleanDto removeFailedAccessEntry(String resourceId,
                                   String remoteHost)
        Removes the specified access failed entry.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - the resource of the access failed entry
        remoteHost - the remote host of the failed access entry
        Returns:
        true if the resource was removed from the store otherwise false

      • removeObsoleteFailedAccessEntries

        void removeObsoleteFailedAccessEntries()
        Removes obsolete failed access entries.

      • accessSucceeded

        AccessResultDto accessSucceeded(String resourceId,
                                String remoteHost,
                                Long timeInMillis)
        Tells the access failed store that the access from the remote host to the specified resource was successfully. If the counter of the failed access entry is already higher than the threshold of the store, the access to the resource will stay blocked, otherwise the access is granted.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - the resource
        remoteHost - the remote host
        timeInMillis - the current time stamp (may be null)
        Returns:
        the access result

      • accessFailed

        AccessResultDto accessFailed(String resourceId,
                             String remoteHost,
                             Long timeInMillis)
        Stores a failed access entry for the specified resource and remote host. If an entry already exists, the counter will be incremented. If the counter of the failed access entry is lower than the threshold of the store, the access to the resource is not blocked otherwise it is blocked.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - the resource
        remoteHost - the remote host
        timeInMillis - the current time stamp (may be null)
        Returns:
        the access result

      • isAccessGranted

        AccessResultDto isAccessGranted(String resourceId,
                                String remoteHost)
        Returns whether the access to the specified resource is granted for the specified remote host or not.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - the resource
        remoteHost - the remote host
        Returns:
        the access result
